subject: Communication
title: The Foot-in-the-Door Technique
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Foot-in-the-Door Technique usable.

hook.text: A neighbor asks you to sign a petition. Next week, they ask you to put a billboard in your yard. You agree.

buildup.text: The foot-in-the-door technique starts with a small request to make a larger request feel reasonable.

discovery.text: Freedman and Fraser found people who agreed to a tiny favor were 4x more likely to agree to a big one.

twist.text: It works because we want to be consistent. Once we say yes, saying no feels like contradicting ourselves.

climax.text: Subscription free trials, loyalty programs, and cult recruitment all use this escalation strategy.

punchline.text: The biggest commitments start with the smallest yes.

quiz.question: Why does the foot-in-the-door technique work?
options: We want to be consistent with past behavior
